etymology.description: 幸 (good fortune) + 福 (blessing) = happiness; well-being.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of being fortunate with received blessings, conveying a state of lasting well-being and contentment.

examples.chinese: 她追求简单的生活(她追求簡單的生活)，就能感到幸福(就能感到幸福)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhuīqiú jiǎndān de shēnghuó, jiù néng gǎndào xìngfú.
examples.english: She pursues a simple life and can feel happiness.

examples.chinese: 家人的支持(家人的支持)，让他觉得很幸福(讓他覺得很幸福)。
examples.pinyin: Jiārén de zhīchí, ràng tā juéde hěn xìngfú.
examples.english: Support from family makes him feel very happy.

examples.chinese: 祝你们永远幸福美满(祝你們永遠幸福美滿)。
examples.english: Wishing you everlasting happiness and a perfect union.
